%s cores %s frequencies %s governors %d core %d cores CPU Usage %s CPU Usage You can\'t offline this core! CPU Maximum Frequency Set the maximum frequency the CPU scales up to. CPU Minimum Frequency Set the minimum frequency the CPU scales down to. CPU Maximum Screen Off Frequency Set the maximum frequency the CPU scales up to when the screen is off. CPU Governor The CPU governor determines how the CPU behaves in response to changes in workload. Changing the governor will impact how the CPU scales through the frequency steps available to your CPU. CPU Governor Tunables The various configuration items which are Governor-dependent. Failed to read current governor of CPU.\n\nIf you are using a QCOM big.LITTLE device this is a known problem. The system forces the CPU to turn off cores making it extremely hard to read out CPU specific stats. Try to select this option again. The CPU sometimes refuses to turn on a core. %s is not tuneable Manual Multicore Power Saving Try to group tasks into the least cores possible. Disabled Enabled Aggressive Schedule workqueues on awake CPUs to save power. CFS Scheduler Policy Policy decides the CFS scheduler how to balance tasks onto different CPU unit. CPUQuiet CPUQuiet implements pluggable policies for forcing cpu cores into quiescent state. Appropriate policies will save power without hurting performance. CPUQuiet Governor CPU Boost Debug Mask Allows you to activate debug mask for operations. Interval Minimum interval a CPU is boosted. Sync Threshold When CPU loading crosses the preset threshold, the current CPU is raised to this frequency. Input Interval Minimum interval a CPU is boosted when input is detected. Input Boost Frequency Input Boost Frequency Core %d CPU frequency to be boosted to this frequency upon input detection. Wakeup Boost Wakeup Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when screen is turned on. Hotplug Boost Hotplug Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when CPUs go online. Touch Boost This will boost your minimum CPU speed if you touch the screen or press a button. MSM Limiter Enable MSM Limiter by neobuddy89. Frequency Control Allow MSM Limiter to Control the Frequencies of your CPUs. Dynamic Stune Boost Stune Boost Duration Stune Boost Settings Enable to get access to advanced stune boost settings.
CPU Input Boost Enable CPU Input Boost, an event-based CPU boosting driver by Sultanxda. Input Boost Duration Set CPU Input Boost duration Wake Boost Duration Cluster Return Frequency
More than one hotplugging system is enabled!\nPlease only use one. MPDecision Qualcomm\'s hotplugging solution. You might get problems with changing frequencies when this is enabled. IntelliPlug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by faux123. The number in the parentheses indicates the amount of cores online at any time. InSaNiTy Balanced Performance Conservative Eco InSaNiTy Eco Performance Eco Conservative Tri Eco Strict Eco Mode Battery saving mode for IntelliPlug. Hysteresis Value The lower it is, the faster response. CPU Threshold The higher, the less CPUs are used. Suspend Prevent to suspend. CPUs Boosted Maximum number of CPUs boosted at the same time. Minimum CPU Online Minimum number of CPUs that will be online. Maximum CPU Online Maximum number of CPUs that will be online. Maximum CPU Screen Off Maximum number of CPUs that will be online when the screen is off. Suspend Defer Time Defer Sampling Boost Lock Duration Minimum interval a CPU is boosted. Down Lock Duration Minimum interval a CPU is kept online. FShift LazyPlug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by arter97. Lazy Possible CPU Cores Possible CPU Cores that lazyplug can use. Blu_Plug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Code_Blue team. Powersaver Mode Sets 1 CPU maximum online with frequency @1728MHz. Up Threshold Over this threshold the driver will put one more core online. Up Timer Control Control timer for up CPUs. Down Timer Control Control timer for down CPUs. Mako Hotplug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by franciscofranco. CPUs on touch Number of CPUs online when touching screen or pressing button. CPU Frequency Unplug Limit First Level The threshold to online all CPUs. High Load Counter Load Threshold The threshold to online all CPUs. Max Load Counter Min Time CPU Online Timer Screen off Single CPU Use only one CPU when screen is off. Delay Time between checks. MSM Hotplug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by myfluxi. History Size Number of samples taken in consideration for average load across CPUs. Lower means quicker/more erratic. Update Rate Interval between taking samples of load across CPUs. Lower means quicker/more erratic. Fast Lane Load Improve latencies by instantly putting online all CPUs if current load on any CPU is above a certain threshold. Fast Lane Min Frequency Sets the minimum frequency the CPU scales down to when fast lane reaches the above load. Offline Load Don\'t offline a CPU if it drops under the lower levels up threshold load. Alucard Hotplug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Alucard. Sampling Rate CPU Down Rate CPU Up Rate IO is Busy Used to make the hotplug consider the I/O time as CPU load time. Quad-Core mode Dual-Core mode MSM MPDecision Hotplug Bricked Hotplug An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by show-p1984. Idle Frequency If the first core is below this frequency, then don\'t plug the other cores. Touch Boost Time How long the CPU should be boosted after touching the screen. Boost Frequency Core %d Start delay Time delay in milliseconds until Hotplug starts to work. Pause If something else plugs in the CPU, fall asleep for this much milliseconds of time. AutoSMP An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by mrg666. Downrate Limits Uprate Limits Cycle Down Cycles to wait after the last hotplug event to unplug another core. Cycle Up Cycles to wait after the last hotplug event to plug another core. Core Control Qualcomm\'s hotplugging solution. Sorry you can\'t turn it off. #blameqcom Minimum Boost Frequency Hotplug Suspend H-Cube OnePlus\' modified Core Control. Minimum CPUs big Minimum amount of big CPUs that should be online. Busy Down Threshold Threshold when big CPUs should be turned off. Busy Up Threshold Threshold when big CPUs should be turned on. Task Threshold Threshold when balancing tasks into big CPU units. Offline Delay Time before turning off a CPU. Online Delay Time before turning on a CPU. MSM Sleeper An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by flar2. Offline Core Threshold Online Core Threshold Max Online Cores during suspend Hotplug Frequency Hotplug Load Hotplug Rate Hotplug RQ Advanced Settings
Global Offset Override Minimum Voltage Disable to remove manufacturer limits on undervolting
Frequencies GPU 2D Frequency GPU 2D Maximum Frequency Set the maximum 2D frequency the GPU scales up to. GPU Maximum Frequency Set the maximum frequency the GPU scales up to. GPU Minimum Frequency Set the minimum frequency the GPU scales down to. GPU 2D Governor Set the 2D governor of the GPU. GPU Governor Set the governor of the GPU. GPU Governor Tunables Simple GPU Algorithm An add-on for MSM Adreno TZ GPU Governor. Developed by faux123. AdrenoBoost An add-on for MSM Adreno TZ GPU Governor. Developed by flar2 Devfreq Boost Boost Duration Set devfreq boost duration Boost Frequency Set devfreq boost frequency Laziness This increases the threshold to ramp up or down GPU frequencies. The lower it is, the more performance you get. Ramp Thresold This increases the number of times the GPU governor ramp down requests. The higher it is, the more performance you get. Adreno Idler An efficient workaround for msm-adreno-tz\'s overheads. Developed by arter97. Down Differential Threshold for determining if the given workload is idle. Idle Wait Number of events to wait before ramping down the frequency. The idlewait\'th events before current one must be all idle before Adreno idler ramps down the frequency. This implementation is to prevent micro-lags on scrolling or playing games. Adreno idler will more actively try to ramp down the frequency if this is set to a lower value. Workload Adreno idler will more actively try to ramp down the frequency if this is set to a higher value.
Use only one thermal driver from the following options, using more at the same time may cause unexpected behavior. Thermald Stock thermal driver that prevents device from overheating. This should be disabled if current kernel has an alternative. Intellithermal An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by faux123. Intellithermal Optimized An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by faux123 and alucard_24. Allows you to activate debug mask for thermal operations. VDD Restriction Frequency Throttle Temperature Temperature to start throttling frequencies. CPU Throttle Temperature Temperature to start shutting down CPUs. CPU Temperature Hysteresis Frequency Step Immediately Limit Stop Poll Sampling interval to read sensor. Temperature Hysteresis Thermal Limit Low Thermal Limit High Temperature Safety Temperature Throttle SoC temperature limit toggle. Temperature Limit If the temperature goes above, the thermal will throttle the CPU frequency to lower the temperature. Frequency Limit Debug This allows to debug the CPUs throttle when the temperature reaches maximum. Temperature Limit Minimum Frequency The thermal will use this frequency to throttle the maximum temperature. Phase 1: Allowed Low Low Phase 1: Allowed Low High Phase 1: Allowed Low Frequency Phase 2: Allowed Mid Low Phase 2: Allowed Mid High Phase 2: Allowed Mid Frequency Phase 3: Allowed Max Low Phase 3: Allowed Max High Phase 3: Allowed Max Frequency Check Interval Shutdown Temperature MSM Thermal Simple Thermal Monitor An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by Sultanxda. User Maximum Frequency Thermal Zones Frequency Mitigation Temperature Threshold temperature to mitigate the CPU max frequency. Hotplugging Temperature Threshold temperature to start shutting down cores. Core Control Mask The cpu mask that will be used to determine if a core can be controlled or not (Set 0 to disable). Frequency Control Mask The cpu mask that will be used to determine if a core can be used for freq control. Frequency Mitigation Control Mask The frequency mitigation bitmask that will be used to determine if KTM should do emergency frequency mitigation for a core or not.
Capacity Battery Life eXtender Set a limit for the capacity to which the battery will be charged by passing a value between 0 and 100. Enable Charging Warning! Charging will be stopped immediately if disabled. Thunder Charge Enable Thunder Charge by varun.chitre15
Advanced Charge Control Interface Fast Charge If enabled, the device will charge faster when connected to USB. Select custom mode to charge your device in a custom level. Replug your charger when changing these options. OTG Switch Permanently enable USB On-The-Go (OTG) mode on supported OnePlus devices. Device will charge faster when connected with USB. Replug your charger when changing this option. Custom Mode Charge Level (AC) Charge Level (USB) Charge Level (Wireless) Choose your Level (mA) MTP while Fast Charge Enable MTP while fast charge Screen On Current Limit Enable Screen On Current Limit Set 0 for stock charge logic
Sound Control Speaker Driver Leakage Software workaround to avoid leakage on the speaker driver Headset High Performance Mode Headphone Gain Speaker Gain> Headphone Amp Gain (TPA6165 Extension) Microphone Gain Volume Gain Boeffla Sound Turn On/Off Boeffla Sound Engine Earpiece Gain (Calls) Faux Sound Turn On/Off Faux Sound Engine Lock Microphone Gain Prevent modifications to microphone gains Per-channel controls
Screen Color Red Green Blue Minimum RGB Value Invert Screen Saturation Intensity Grayscale Mode Screen Hue You might get problems with MSM8x26 SoC when setting a high value. Screen Value Screen Contrast High Brightness Mode sRGB Gamma Red Greys Red Mids Red Blacks Red Whites Green Greys Green Mids Green Blacks Green Whites Blue Greys Blue Mids Blue Blacks Blue Whites Contrast Brightness Red Positive Red Negative Green Positive Green Negative Blue Positive Blue Negative White Point LCD Backlight After selecting a profile, please turn your screen off and on. Use exponential backlight mode instead of linear mode. Minimum Brightness Allows you to decrease the LCD screen brightness lower than it\'s possible on stock. Maximum Brightness Allows you to increase the LCD screen brightness higher than it\'s possible on stock. Backlight Dimmer Threshold Value Offset Negative Toggle Enable inverting the screen colors by quickly pressing MENU button 4 times. mDNIe global controls Register Hook Register intercept acts like a hook and will enable catching scenario settings and modifying them through delta controls. If a scenario does not have a setting (register) in its base sequence, then it cannot be modified by the hook. Master Sequence Enabling the master sequence will disable and ignore Samsung\'s profiles and scenarios, the ROM controls will be disabled. Glove Mode Enabling this will let you use your phone even while wearing gloves.
K-Lapse Select preferred K-Lapse mode, a kernel level live-display module by tanish2k09. This shouldn\'t be Turned-Off to tune the rest of K-Lapse parameters. Turned-Off Time Based Scaling Brightness Based Scaling Night Mode Schedule (Hour) Start End Scaling Rate (Minute) Controls how soon the RGB reaches from Daytime to Night Mode inside of start and stop hour range. Fade-back Time (Minute) The number of minutes before End Time when RGB should start going back to Daytime colors. Daytime Colors Night Mode Colors Auto-brightness Automatically set the brightness factor in a set time range. Brightness Factor 10: Accurate brightness; 5: 50% of current brightness. Auto-brightness Schedule (Hour) Backlight Range Pulse Frequency The number of milliseconds after which klapse_pulse is called.
DoubleTap2Wake Wake up your device by double tapping the screen. Center Full Bottom half Top half Half Sweep2Wake Wake up your device by swiping on the screen. Sweep2Wake + Sweep2Sleep Sweep2Sleep Sweep2Wake Right Sweep2Wake Left Sweep2Wake Up Sweep2Wake Down Sweep2Wake Any Sweep2Wake Leniency Only require 1st and 4th button to trigger Sweep2Wake. Tap2Wake Wake up your device by tapping the screen. DoubleTap2Sleep Lock your device by double tapping on the top of the screen. Sweep2Wake while charging DoubleTap2Wake while charging DoubleTap2Wake + Sweep2Wake DoubleTap2Wake + Sweep2Wake while charging Lock you device by swiping on the screen. Sweep Right Sweep Left Sweep Left or Right Slide up Slide down Slide left Slide right Draw E Draw O Draw W Draw C Draw M Camera Gesture Launch default camera by drawing a circle on the screen. Pocket Mode Enabling this will turn off wake controls when the device is in a pocket. Timeout Set a duration when the wake controls will be disabled after the screen goes off. Charge Timeout Set a duration when the wake controls will be disabled after the screen goes off while charging. Power Key Suspend Enabling this will turn off wake controls when the screen is turned off by the power key. Area Width Height Vibration Vibration Strength Power Key Mode Wake controls will only be active when you put your device into sleep with the power key. Charging Mode Wake controls will only be active when device is charging. Up Down Left Right
LED Notification Blink/Fade Intensity Speed Stock Continuous light Bright Light Environment Set the relative intensity of the LED when in bright environments. Low Light Environment Set the relative intensity of the LED when in low brightness environments. Notification On Off Fade Ramp Control Enable or disable LED fade-in/out (ramp) control. Fade in Sets the time period of the rising slope. Fade out Sets the time period of the falling slope. Display Backlight
Internal Storage External Storage Scheduler Set the active I/O elevator algorithm. The Scheduler decides how to handle I/O requests. Scheduler Tunable The various configuration items which are Scheduler-dependent. Read-ahead The Read-ahead value on the phone memory. Rotational Storage Treat device as rotational storage. I/O Stats Maintain I/O statistics for this storage device. Disabling will break I/O monitoring apps. Add Random Draw entropy from spinning (rotational) storage. RQ Affinity Try to have scheduler requests complete on the CPU core they were made from. Higher values are more aggressive. No-Merges This enables the user to disable the lookup logic involved with IO merging requests in the block layer. NR Requests This controls how many requests may be allocated in the block layer for read or write requests.
Full scans Pages shared Pages sharing Pages unshared Pages volatile Reduces memory usage but has an impact on the CPU usage. Pages to scan Sleep between scans Deferred timer Reduces some CPU usage in return for less memory savings. Max CPU Usage Max CPU percentage to use when merging pages. UKSM CPU Governor Set the CPU Governor for UKSM.
Foreground Applications Adaptive Low Memory Killer Make LMK more aggressive dynamically when a thrashing scenario is detected. Visible Applications Secondary Server Hidden Applications Content Providers Empty Applications Very light Light Medium Very Aggressive Kill LMK Kill LMK when swap is in use. Kill LMK Threshold How full swap needs to be to kill LMK.
Wakelocks Other Wakelocks Wakelocks are there for a reason. This means, by blocking some of them you can introduce smaller or bigger issues, trigger strange side effects and in the worst case render the system completely unusable. Blocking wakelocks is solely your own responsibility. Boeffla Generic Wakelock Blocker Wakelocks order Select the listing order of the Wakelocks Wakelocks Blocked Wakelocks Allowed Time Wakeups Name Time Wakeups smb135x Wakelock Prevent wakelock when power disconnected. sensor_ind Wakelock Prevent wakelock when Ambient Display disabled. msm_hsic_host Wakelock Prevent msm_hsic_host wakelock. wlan_rx Wakelock Prevent wlan_rx wakelock. wlan_ctrl Wakelock Prevent wlan_ctrl wakelock. wlan Wakelock Prevent wlan wakelock. BlueSleep Wakelock Prevent BlueSleep wakelock. Ipa Wakelock Prevent Ipa wakelock. NetLink Wakelock Prevent NetLink wakelock. Qcom rx Wakelock Prevent Qcom rx wakelock. Timerfd Wakelock Prevent Timerfd wakelock. Extscan Wakelock Prevent Extscan wakelock. wlan_ws Wakelock Prevent wlan_ws wakelock. Bluedroid Timer Wakelock Prevent Bluedroid Timer wakelock. wlan_rx Wakelock Divider wlan_ctrl Wakelock Divider msm_hsic Wakelock Divider BCMDHD Wakelock Divider SensorHub The SensorHub Wakelock is one of the biggest wake sources. Disable for better deep sleep and less awake time. Enable for stock behavior. SSP The SSP Wakelock is one of the biggest wake sources after Sensorhub. Disable for better deep sleep and less awake time. Enable for stock behavior. GPS The bcm4359 Wakelock (GPS chip) is one of the biggest wake sources after Sensorhub & SSP. Disable for better deep sleep and less awake time. Enable for stock behavior. Wireless Wireless Wakelock. Disable for better deep sleep and less awake time. Enable for stock behavior. Bluetooth Bluetooth Wakelock. Disable for better deep sleep and less awake time. Enable for stock behavior.
SWAP Z-RAM Z-RAM Algorithm Set default Z-RAM Compression algorithm.\nReduce Z-RAM Disksize to \'0\' before changing this option. Disksize Attempts to increase performance by avoiding paging on physical storage, instead using a compressed virtual device in RAM. Paging takes place in RAM until it is necessary to use the swap space on physical storage. ZSWAP ZSwap is a lightweight compressed cache for swap pages. It takes pages that are in the process of being swapped out and attempts to compress them into a dynamically allocated RAM-based memory pool. Zswap basically trades CPU cycles for potentially reduced swap I/O. Memory pool Memory pool percentage of main memory that may be used as compressed page cache. Maximum compression ratio Maximum compression ratio, as percentage, for an acceptable compressed page. Any page that does not compress by at least this ratio will be rejected.
Available Poolsize Read Write
Android logging Turn On/Off Android logging PrintK logging Turn On/Off Linux PrintK logging Doze Mode Enable doze mode to prevents certain tasks from running if your device is in idle state. SELinux Switch Disable to switch SELinux into Permissive Software CRC control CRC is a mechanism aiming to prevent data corruption when enabled. Data blocks can lose up to 30% of their performance. Fsync Disable for better file system performance at the risk of data loss in case of a system crash. Dynamic Fsync When enabled and screen is on, fsync operation is asynchronous. When screen is off, this operation is done synchronously. Gentle Fair Sleepers Only give sleepers 50% of their service deficit. Disabling this can save a little battery power. Arch Power Enable Arch Specific Power Function/Savings. Power Suspend Power Suspend Mode Kernel Mode, LCD Hooks and Highest Level Hook are automatically managed by the kernel. To manually enable or disable the Power Suspend State choose User Mode. Autosleep Userspace LCD Panel Hybrid Power Suspend State Kernel power management driver when screen is off. Better battery savings if enabled. Note: You can only change this setting if Power Suspend Mode is in User Mode. Network TCP Congestion Algorithm The Transmission Control Protocol is one of the core protocols of the Internet protocol suite (IP), and is so common that the entire suite is often called TCP/IP. Hostname WireGuard VPN Leases Enable Enable or disable file leases on a system-wide basis Lease Break Time The grace period that the kernel grants to a process holding a file lease after it has sent a signal to that process notifying it that another process is waiting to open the file.
Performance Tweaks Profile Performance Tweaks An adaptation of the Spectrum Manager by frap129.\nSelect one among the available pre-defined profiles. Balanced The default kernel profile designed for smooth performance in basic tasks while maintaining fantastic battery. Performance Tuned for top-tier performance in standard tasks with many fewer regressions than Balanced, but maintains battery by limiting graphics. Battery The ultra-conservative profile that lets performance take a hit in order to archive long-lasting battery life. Gaming Identical to performance in most areas other than the unlocked Graphics performance.
Welcome In this section you can create or import custom controls, which don\'t exist in the app (yet). Examples Need example? Click <a href="https://github.com/Grarak/KernelAdiutor/wiki/Custom-Controls">here<a>. Create Import Switch Seekbar Title Description Applying Whether the switch is enabled. Return 1 for enabled and 0 for disabled. The switch will return either 1 (enabled) or 0 (disabled) as argument to your shell script. Min Max Progress Current state of the seekbar. By defining min and max an integer array gets created. For example: Min is 50 and Max is 100 and progress is 0, that would mean 50 is the current state of the seekbar. Seekbar will return its current progress. For example your Min is 50 and Max 100 and the seekbar is at 70, it will return 20 as progress. Generic Value Current value of the editor. Can be basically anything. Editor will return whatever was entered. required You have to hit test first! Output Edit Export Delete Are you sure? Name %s already exists! %1$s has been exported to %2$s Name is empty! Import file is malformed! Version of import file is too old!
Boot partition Recovery partition Fota partition Flash Flasher Click the flash button to select and flash a recovery ZIP file without rebooting into custom recovery. The changes were applied after a reboot. Flash Now
Add %1$s has been backed up to %2$s %s item %s items Key Value Key can\'t be empty!
In profiles mode your changes won\'t have an impact on apply on boot. Everything you change here is gonna be saved to your profile. But attention! Your settings will also get applied, but won\'t get saved to apply on boot. No changes made! Apply %s? Append Details Press %s again to apply. Applied Profile Tasker If you want to apply a profile at a specific event, such as launching an application, you have to use Tasker. Show toast when tasker applies a profile Profile Tile Show a tile which allows you to select a profile. Select Profile Applying %s! No profile found! You have to create them first. All sections disabled! No profiles for you. New Current settings Select all Nothing selected Profile is empty!
Emulate Init.d If your device doesn\'t support Init.d by default, you can enable this to emulate its behaviour. Execute %s? Executing Result
This section shows you what things will happen when your device boots up. If it\'s blank, then nothing will happen after boot. Delete %s? Arguments: %s Disable %s?
Support Visit support page at xda-developers.com Website Visit SmartPack homepage Download \nClick \'Download\' to initialize auto kernel updates.\n\nWarning! Downloading will take some time to finish! Please be patient!\n\nYou will be notified by the App once the new kernel is ready to flash.\n Auto-flash \nSmartPack-Kernel is downloaded and ready for auto-flashing. Do you want to flash it NOW?\n\nPlease note: Your device will be automatically rebooted after the flashing process.\n Install Now \nSmartPack-Kernel is downloaded into \'/sdcard/Download/\'\n\nDo you want to Install it NOW?\n \nSorry! Auto-flash will NOT work on this device. However, you can manually flash the Kernel once the download is completed.\nDo you want to reboot?\n \nAre you running an unsupported android version?\n\nIf not, please check your internet connection!\n\n Advanced Options Reboot Reboot Now Reboot Later Reboot Recovery Reboot Bootloader Wipe Data Wipe Cache Install later> Backing up Flashing Restoring Reset App Reset User Settings \nApp settings will be completely erased.\n\nAre you sure?\n Reboot device into Recovery Mode Reboot device into Download Mode To avoid configuration failures, it is highly recommended to reboot the system.\n\nDo you want to reboot?\n \nYour device will be rebooted into Recovery mode.\n \nYour device will be rebooted into Download Mode.\n Wipe Cache Partition Wipe Data Partition \nCache/Dalvik Cache partitions of your device will be erased.\n\nAttention! The device will be Rebooted.\n \nData partition of your device will be completely erased.\n\nWarning! You will lose all the user data including apps.\n\nAttention! The device will be Rebooted.\n Click here to check the latest version info \n(Click here to re-check) \n(Click here to Get It!) Failed to get latest version info! Please check your internet connection Congrats! You are up-to-date Unsupported Version SmartPack-Kernel is not (yet) available for your Android version
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SmartPack/SmartPack-Kernel-Manager/master/download/App-update.json New update available!\nv%2$s Check for Updates Check for new versions of SmartPack-Kernel Manager New update available! Update %1$s is available to download. By downloading the latest update you will get the latest features, improvements and bug fixes for %2$s. Update %1$s is available to download.\n\nYou can get these new features:\n%2$s Update %1$s is available! Update %1$s of %2$s is available to download Congrats "You've already got an up-to-date version of SmartPack-Kernel Manager! Update Don\'t show again Dismiss Update notifications appupdater_channel_01 Downloading... Download FAILED!
Open Settings Fahrenheit Use fahrenheit to measure temperature. Force displaying english language User interface Dark theme Material icon Banner resizer Phone screen orientation should be \'Portrait\'! Hide banner Force cards Use cards for items if possible. Accent Color Instant 5 seconds 10 seconds 20 seconds 50 seconds Test apply on boot. This includes all kind of things which are getting applied during booting, such as custom controls, profiles, init.d, etc. Apply on boot service is already running. Please wait until it finishes. Test Nothing found to apply! Hide Hide the notification of apply on boot. Delay will still remain! Toast Show toast when settings got applied. Confirmation Notification After apply on boot with visible notification, show a notification afterwards with the confirmation that apply on boot was successful. Script Use a shell script to apply settings. Please only enable this if you have troubles with apply on boot. If the problem still persists after enabling this option, please make sure no other app is conflicting with SmartPack-Kernel Manager. Logcat(s) Save all logcats, including radio and events, into \'sdcard\' Last Kernel Message Save /proc/last_kmsg into \'sdcard\' Console Ramoops Save /sys/fs/pstore/console-ramoops* into \'sdcard\' Driver Message Save driver message (dmesg) into \'sdcard\' Driver Ramoops Save /sys/fs/pstore/dmesg-ramoops* into \'sdcard\' Security Set Password You can protect SmartPack-Kernel Manager by setting up a password. Every time you open this application, you have to enter it. If you forget it, simply wipe the data of this application in settings of your device. Don\'t worry I won\'t share your password. Delete Password Old password New password Confirm new password Old password is wrong Password is empty New password doesn\'t match confirmation Password is too long (max. 32 characters) Set a password first Use fingerprint to pass security check. This will work as long you have fingerprints registered. Sections
SmartPack-Kernel Manager is a heavily modified version of official Kernel Adiutor, which is originally developed by Willi Ye aka Grarak. All the credits goes to the original developer. Libraries used Source Code View source code at GitHub Change-logs View Change-logs Donate to Me Want to appreciate my work with a Donation? Click here \nIf you like to appreciate my work, please consider donating to me as it is helpful to continue my projects more active, although it is not at all necessary.\n \nPlease note: I can accept donations either via PayPal, or through SmartPack Donation Package in PlayStore. Moreover, purchasing the donation package will unlock some hidden features in this app.\n Donation App PayPal
%d commits Please check your internet connection! Translators
Q1. How different is this app from Grarak’s official Kernel Adiutor? Ans. This app is heavily modified to meet the needs of various kernel developers. Some of the added features of this app include, but not limited to, i. CPU Input Boost, ii. Adreno Boost, iii. Dynamic Stune Boost, iv. K-Lapse, v. Advanced Charge Control Interface (Samsung msm8974 kernels), vi. Boeffla Wakelocks, vii. Boeffla and Flar\'s sound controls with per-channel support, viii. SELinux switch, ix. OTA support for SmartPack-Kernel, x. Display Backlight Control and many more. Q2. Can I use this App to control any custom kernel? Ans. Why not? This app will work as usual with any kernel, as long as root access granted. Q3. Why doesn\'t my determined CPU freq stick? Ans. This could be due to many reasons. Many kernels nowadays have their own hotplugging system which controls the CPU frequency and CyanogenMod has their own CPU Boost implementation which regulates the frequency. I would suggest you don\'t touch the CPU frequencies and let the kernel do its job. This also counts for other functions! If they don\'t stick, it\'s because the kernel/system doesn\'t want to let you change it. Q4. Why don\'t features x and y show up? Ans. Only features that are implemented to your Kernel are shown. Q5. Could you add feature x and y to your App? Ans. I’m happy to check and add, if possible, any useful features (unless it is too experimental or dangerous) to my App. Please give your suggestions in the xda-developers page. Q6. Can you tell me the best settings for performance/SOT? Ans. It\'s depends on several factors. I can only share my favorite settings that give me the best results in my favorite ROM. Q7. Do I need to wipe cache/dalvik cache before/after flashing a Kernel? Ans. NO. Because the kernel does not even ‘see’ cache/dalvik cache. Q8. I found a bug in your App, what do I do? Ans. Please provide as much information as possible (such as what feature, what didn\'t work, screenshots or logcat if possible) and post in the xda-developers page. Alternately, you may also raise an issue in the GitHub page. Q9. Can I contribute to your Projects? If so, How? Ans. Absolutely. Any kind of contributions (Donations, Code etc.) are most welcomed and highly appreciated. Please visit "About" Section for more details.
